    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        Player()
        Class Player Constructor -> for simulation purposes

      • Player

        Player​(java.lang.String name)
        Class Player Constructor: contains load()

        Check if PlayerSave.txt has a saved Player and load Character, equipments, bag, and money; else construct a "new Player"

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Character

    • Method Detail

      • saveAndClose

        public void saveAndClose()
        Save Player's data to a .txt file -> when at villageLoop (Chief Darius); see: Character.removeStats() | Entity.getEntitySaveStats()

        Player's equipped Items, stats, bag, and money is saved.

        Game will close after being saved.

      • attack

        public void attack​(Entity opp)
        Player's Character attacks against an Entity

        Values of Character's attack/Entity's defense are randomized from half of Character's strength/Entity's defense up to full values, respectively. Deal damage and subtract Entity's hit point accordingly.

        No recoil damage will be dealt to Entity.

        If a sword is equipped by Character, these a 10% chance to deal a cricital hit (when damage > 0: damage * 2)

        Equipments' durabilities are decrease according Player.equipmentUsed().

        Parameters:
        opp - Entity to attack against

      • equipmentUsed

        public void equipmentUsed​(int[] indices)
        Decrease the durability of Equipment(s) after use

        1) Sword: After every attack.

        2) Shield, Helmet, Chestplate, Leggings, Boots: if damage received is >= Character's level (see: Entity.attack()).

        3) Belt, Necklace, bracelet, Ring: every 5 attacks (calculated by Player.attackCount)

        Destroys the Equipment(s) if durability reaches 0, and remove Equipment's stats (see: Character.removeStats()).

        Parameters:
        indices - the indices of Equipment[] equipments to decrease durability(s)

      • equip

        public void equip​(Equipment toEquip)
        Equips an Equipment to Character

        Check if index is null, and equip param toEquip to index Else, unequip at index then equip

        Stats is replaced/added by param toEquip

        Parameters:
        toEquip - the Equipment to equip

      • unequip

        public void unequip​(int index)
        Unequips an Equipment from Character

        Subtract stats of the Equipment from Character -> Add the Equipment to ArrayList bag -> Remove the Equipment from Equipment[] equipments.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of Equipment[] equipments to unequip an Equipment

      • addItemToBag

        public void addItemToBag​(Item item)
        Add an Item to bag, or increase its quantity

        Items (not Equipments) can be stacked, and they are distinguished by having a durability of 0.

        loop through bag and check indices of bag for same name as param item, and add the quantity of the Item at the index with param item's quantity.

        Equipments, regardless of having the same name, are stored as a separate index in bag.

        Parameters:
        item - the Item to add/increase quantity

      • useItemFromBag

        public void useItemFromBag​(Item item,
                           int index)
        Use an Item from bag

        Using an Item (if possible) will decrease its quantity by 1, and if no quantity left, will remove the Item from bag.

        If para item is null, will remove the Item at the index instead.

        HP Potion(S): Will restore Character by 20 HP (will not use if Character is at full HP)

        Parameters:
        item - the Item to use. Remove the Item if null
        the - index of the Item in bag

      • buyItem

        public boolean buyItem​(Item toBuy,
                       int cost)
        "Buy" an Item/Equipment at a cost defined; see: addItemToBag
        Parameters:
        toBuy - the Item/Equipment to purchase
        cost - the cost of the Item/Equipment
        Returns:
        true the Item/Equipment is successfully purchased; false if not

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney​(Entity enemy,
                     int val)
        Add money to Player

        If given param enemy: money is Entity's level + rolled range of 0~average of Entity's max hit point, strength, and defense. Else, add money based on param val

        Parameters:
        enemy - the Entity to get money from
        val - the value to add money if param enemy is null

      • openInterface

        public void openInterface()
        Opens a Player Interface where Player can see own stats; see: Equipment.equip() | Equipment.unequip() | useItemFromBag()

        1) Equipped Items: See equipped Equipments, and able to unequip

        2) Character: print Character

        3) Items: check Items, and able to use or Equip Equipment

        4) Money: print money

      • useShop

        public void useShop()
        Use Merchant Wang's Equipment Shop; see: buyItem()

        1) Equipment of the Shop: a randomly generated Equipment accordingly to Character's level, and has increased rarity roll.

        2) Armory: Able to purchase all Equipments accordingly to Character's level, and rarity is decided accordingly to Equipment.loadRarity(-1).

      • buyPotion

        public void buyPotion()
        Buy potions from Sorcerer Apprentice Melina; see: buyItem()

        1) 1 HP Potion(S): $50

        2) 5 HP Potion(S): $200 ($50 discount)

        3) 10 HP Potion(S): $400 ($100 discount)

      • getEquipments

        public Equipment[] getEquipments()

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter()

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()

      • setMoney

        public void setMoney​(int val)

      • fullEquip

        public void fullEquip​(int rarity)
        CHEAT: fully equip all Equipments accordinly to Character's level
        Parameters:
        rarity - the rarity to set all Equipments
